title: A look at FedEx's sustainability policy - Sustainability Magazine
summary: FedEx has set a goal to achieve carbon neutrality by 2040 and has pledged an initial investment of over $2 billion to help achieve it. The company is focusing on reducing emissions and waste, replacing older technologies and vehicles with more efficient ones, and revolutionizing its operations with new technologies. FedEx is also collaborating with NGOs and other institutions to help restore and protect the environment.
green_innovation: TRUE, FedEx is implementing a variety of green innovations to achieve its sustainability goals, including using electric vehicles, sustainable fuels, fuel conservation and aircraft modernization, more efficient facilities, and natural carbon sequestration.
business_innovation: TRUE, FedEx is implementing a variety of business innovations to achieve its sustainability goals, including using digital technologies to improve the efficiency of its operations and predict problems before they happen, as well as using data-driven tools to give customers visibility into the CO2 emissions their shipping choices create.
green_product: TRUE, FedEx is using 100% recyclable packaging, and 49% is made from recycled materials.
green_process: TRUE, FedEx is using digital technologies including machine learning, artificial intelligence, and advanced analytics to improve the efficiency of its operations and predict problems before they happen.
likely_naics_codes: ['484122 - Passenger Air Transportation, Scheduled', '492110 - Couriers', '541611 - Administrative Management and General Management Consulting Services', '541690 - Other Management Consulting Services']
greenwashing: FALSE, FedEx's sustainability initiatives appear to be genuine and not an example of greenwashing.

title: Top fashion executives share their 2023 sustainability agendas - Vogue Business
summary: Fashion executives predicted a year of sustainability action in 2023, but that will require companies to lead the way. The fashion industry must seek out new, innovative ways of reducing its environmental impact.
green_innovation: TRUE; The article discusses the need for fashion companies to find new, innovative ways of reducing their environmental impact, which meets the definition of a green innovation.
business_innovation: FALSE; The article does not provide enough details about any specific products or processes to determine whether a business innovation took place.
green_product: FALSE; The article does not provide enough details about any specific products to determine whether any of them meet the criteria to be a green product.
green_process: FALSE; The article does not provide enough details about any specific processes to determine whether any of them meet the criteria to be a green process.

title: 12 women cultivating sustainable food systems in 2023 - GreenBiz
summary: This article features 12 women cultivating sustainable food systems. These women are working on a variety of projects, including reducing food waste, developing plant-based foods, and supporting farmers in adopting regenerative agriculture practices. Their work is making a significant contribution to creating a more sustainable and equitable food system.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the article describes several innovations that contribute to environmental sustainability goals, such as reducing food waste, developing plant-based foods, and supporting farmers in adopting regenerative agriculture practices.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the article describes several innovations that are new or improved products or processes that differ significantly from the firm's previous products or processes, such as a cooling cart that uses passive-radiative cooling technology to keep produce fresh for longer, and a meat alternative made from mycelium.
green_product: TRUE, because the article describes several products that are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact throughout their life cycle, such as a cocoa-free chocolate that emits 80 percent less carbon and uses 90 percent less water than conventional chocolates, and a cooling cart that uses passive-radiative cooling technology to keep produce fresh for longer.
green_process: TRUE, because the article describes several processes that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability, such as regenerative agriculture practices that improve soil health and reduce reliance on fertilizers over the long term, and a meat alternative production process that uses mycelium, which has a remarkably lower carbon, water and land footprint than animal-based meat production.
likely_naics_codes: ['111998 - All Other Miscellaneous Crop Farming', '311811 - Retail Bakeries', '311999 - All Other Food Manufacturing', '541330 - Engineering Services']
greenwashing: FALSE, because the innovations described in the article appear to be legitimate efforts to reduce environmental impact.

title: AgriSound's insect listening device installed at Cranswick farms to monitor pollination - Pig World
summary: Cranswick, a British food products supplier, has teamed up with biodiversity firm AgriSound to install in-field insect sensor devices at its pig farms to monitor pollinator activity and biodiversity. The Polly devices use advanced algorithms to allow Cranswick to track pollination and explore biodiversity. Data from the first two months of the Polly’s use at Cranswick has shown an estimated level of around 48,800 pollinators across the farms.
green_innovation: TRUE, The innovation contributes to environmental sustainability goals, such as protecting biological systems and nature and wildlife conservation.
business_innovation: TRUE, The innovation is a new or improved business process that differs significantly from the firm’s previous business processes and that has been brought into use in the firm
green_product: FALSE, The article does not describe a green product innovation.
green_process: TRUE, The innovation is a new or improved business process for one or more business functions that differs significantly from the firm’s previous business processes and that has been brought into use in the firm and minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability.
likely_naics_codes: ['111998 - All Other Miscellaneous Crop Farming', '541990 - All Other Professional, Scientific, and Technical Services', '334419 - Other Electronic Component Manufacturing', '928110 - Nature Parks and Other Similar Institutions']
greenwashing: FALSE, The article does not provide any evidence of greenwashing.
